unnormalised: ## Ditching the CDs: My Love Affair with Music Streaming!
normalised: ## Ditching the CDs: My Love Affair with Music Streaming!

unnormalised: Hey folks! Remember those days of painstakingly ripping CDs onto your computer, creating endless playlists, and praying your iPod wouldn't die mid-journey from Delhi to Mumbai? Those days are thankfully fading faster than the memory of the *Race 3* plotline (sorry, Salman!).
normalised: Hey folks! Remember those days of painstakingly ripping CDs onto your computer, creating endless playlists, and praying your iPod wouldn't die mid-journey from Delhi to Mumbai? Those days are thankfully fading faster than the memory of the Race three plotline (sorry, Salman!).

unnormalised: I've officially embraced the music streaming life, and honestly, it's a total game-changer. No more bulky CDs taking up precious space in my cupboard, no more agonizing over which songs to delete to make room for new tracks. Just pure, unadulterated musical bliss at my fingertips.
normalised: I've officially embraced the music streaming life, and honestly, it's a total game-changer. No more bulky CDs taking up precious space in my cupboard, no more agonizing over which songs to delete to make room for new tracks. Just pure, unadulterated musical bliss at my fingertips.

unnormalised: Think about it - I can listen to a Carnatic recital by M.S. Subbulakshmi while I'm cooking (thanks, Spotify!), then switch to the latest Bollywood banger from Arijit Singh for my evening chai. The sheer variety is mind-boggling! I even rediscovered some awesome indie artists from IIT Bombay's cultural fests thanks to curated playlists. Who knew?
normalised: Think about it - I can listen to a Carnatic recital by M.S. Subbulakshmi while I'm cooking (thanks, Spotify!), then switch to the latest Bollywood banger from Arijit Singh for my evening chai. The sheer variety is mind-boggling! I even rediscovered some awesome indie artists from I I T Bombay's cultural fests thanks to curated playlists. Who knew?

unnormalised: The best part? It's incredibly affordable. I pay like Rs. 129 a month for a family plan, which is way cheaper than buying even one new album. And the personalized recommendations are usually spot-on. Just yesterday, I discovered a new qawwali group from Lucknow that I'm absolutely obsessed with.
normalised: The best part? It's incredibly affordable. I pay like rupee one hundred and twenty nine a month for a family plan, which is way cheaper than buying even one new album. And the personalized recommendations are usually spot-on. Just yesterday, I discovered a new qawwali group from Lucknow that I'm absolutely obsessed with.

unnormalised: Of course, there are downsides. Data usage can be a pain, especially when traveling through areas with poor connectivity. And sometimes, my phone decides to buffer right in the middle of my favorite song. But hey, those are minor inconveniences compared to the sheer convenience and joy of having access to virtually every song ever made!
normalised: Of course, there are downsides. Data usage can be a pain, especially when traveling through areas with poor connectivity. And sometimes, my phone decides to buffer right in the middle of my favorite song. But hey, those are minor inconveniences compared to the sheer convenience and joy of having access to virtually every song ever made!

unnormalised: So, are you still clinging to your old CD collection? Maybe it's time to take the plunge and join the music streaming revolution. Trust me, your ears (and your shelf space) will thank you! What are your favorite music streaming apps? Let me know in the comments below! Happy listening, dosto!
